meanings.definition: A structural piece of stone, wood, or metal jutting from a wall to support a weight.
meanings.sent1: The ancient castle had a sturdy corbel supporting the heavy stone wall.
meanings.sent2: The mason carefully placed the corbel to hold up the massive structure.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the corbel as a lookout point to spy on the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the corbel that held up her resolve during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The corbel, like a loyal friend, silently bore the weight of the wall without complaint.

meanings.definition: To provide with a corbel or corbels.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter will corbel the beam to ensure it is securely in place.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to corbel the shelf to make it more stable.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to corbel their treehouse with extra branches for added support.
meanings.sent4: He will corbel his bookshelf with additional screws to prevent it from falling.
meanings.sent5: The builder will corbel the archway to give it a decorative touch.

meanings.definition: A bracket or block supporting a cornice or projecting beam.
meanings.sent1: The elegant cornice was held in place by a beautifully carved corbel.
meanings.sent2: The architect included a decorative corbel to enhance the appearance of the building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked over the corbel, causing the cornice to fall.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the corbel that supported her confidence during the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The corbel, like a guardian angel, watched over the cornice with unwavering strength.
